summary: This bill, the Arctic Refuge Protection Act of 2025, proposes to designate a portion of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge in Alaska as wilderness. Introduced in the Senate by Senator Markey and others, the bill amends the National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966 to include approximately 1,559,538 acres of the refuge within the National Wilderness Preservation System. The bill was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
